values.description:
Fixed issue #381 and ended up doing some cleanup in `drcsim/setup.sh`.  I'm fairly confident that I got it right, but testing in more build configurations (system vs. source-build gazebo, etc.).

I also worked around #383 by creating symlinks.  @_jrivero_  : I assume that those symlinks will be properly included in the binary debs?
values.title: Cleaned up drcsim/setup.sh.

summary.raw:
Fixed issue #381 and ended up doing some cleanup in `drcsim/setup.sh`.  I'm fairly confident that I got it right, but testing in more build configurations (system vs. source-build gazebo, etc.).

I also worked around #383 by creating symlinks.  @_jrivero_  : I assume that those symlinks will be properly included in the binary debs?
summary.html:
Fixed issue #381 and ended up doing some cleanup in drcsim/setup.sh. I'm fairly confident that I got it right, but testing in more build configurations (system vs. source-build gazebo, etc.).

I also worked around #383 by creating symlinks. @jrivero : I assume that those symlinks will be properly included in the binary debs?

values.description:
As idenitifed in #373, there's a need for standalone versions of important models like the Atlas.  Users should be able to load such models into their own software without ROS, or even Gazebo.  They just need to be able to parse SDF/URDF.

In drcsim 3.1.0, we moved to a runtime-spawn model, with xacro generation, that has made it much more difficult to load these models.

This pull request adds some steps to the build to generate, for each `foo.urdf.xacro` file, a `foo` model.  These models go into a `standalone_models` directory, one for each package.

To test this:

* Install Gazebo (e.g., 2.0.0)
* Build and install drcsim from this branch.
* In a fresh shell, without any ROS or drcsim setup files, add some directories to your `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH` and run Gazebo:

        export GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH=<install_prefix>/share/atlas_description/standalone_models:<install_prefix>/share/irobot_hand_description/standalone_models:<install_prefix>/share/multisense_sl_description/standalone_models
        gazebo

    You can now insert any of the various flavors of Atlas, the iRobot hand, or the Multisense head.  There are no plugins loaded (those need ROS), to the models will be uncontrolled.

Usage will vary from case to case, but I would imagine that folks like @jespersmith will copy the content of the `standalone_models` directories somewhere else, to be read by their own software.
values.title: Add standalone versions of models

This pull request adds some steps to the build to generate, for each `foo.urdf.xacro` file, a `foo` model.  These models go into a `standalone_models` directory, one for each package.

* Build and install drcsim from this branch.

Usage will vary from case to case, but I would imagine that folks like @jespersmith will copy the content of the `standalone_models` directories somewhere else, to be read by their own software.
summary.html:
As idenitifed in #373, there's a need for standalone versions of important models like the Atlas. Users should be able to load such models into their own software without ROS, or even Gazebo. They just need to be able to parse SDF/URDF.

In drcsim 3.1.0, we moved to a runtime-spawn model, with xacro generation, that has made it much more difficult to load these models.

This pull request adds some steps to the build to generate, for each foo.urdf.xacro file, a foo model. These models go into a standalone_models directory, one for each package.

To test this:

  • Install Gazebo (e.g., 2.0.0)
  • Build and install drcsim from this branch.

  • In a fresh shell, without any ROS or drcsim setup files, add some directories to your GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH and run Gazebo:

    export GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH=<install_prefix>/share/atlas_description/standalone_models:<install_prefix>/share/irobot_hand_description/standalone_models:<install_prefix>/share/multisense_sl_description/standalone_models
gazebo

    You can now insert any of the various flavors of Atlas, the iRobot hand, or the Multisense head. There are no plugins loaded (those need ROS), to the models will be uncontrolled.

Usage will vary from case to case, but I would imagine that folks like @jespersmith will copy the content of the standalone_models directories somewhere else, to be read by their own software.

values.description: `catkin_make_isolated --install` currently fails, as documented in #372. This fix installs the plugins to lib instead of a subfolder of lib. A namespace is applied to plugin name, to avoid polluting the lib folder. Also, the headers for drcsim_gazebo_plugins were not being installed.
values.title: Fix #372: catkin_make_isolated --install

summary.raw: `catkin_make_isolated --install` currently fails, as documented in #372. This fix installs the plugins to lib instead of a subfolder of lib. A namespace is applied to plugin name, to avoid polluting the lib folder. Also, the headers for drcsim_gazebo_plugins were not being installed.
summary.html: catkin_make_isolated --install currently fails, as documented in #372. This fix installs the plugins to lib instead of a subfolder of lib. A namespace is applied to plugin name, to avoid polluting the lib folder. Also, the headers for drcsim_gazebo_plugins were not being installed.

values.reason: On second thought, I shouldn't rename the plugin. I'll try to figure out a better solution.

values.description:
Since catkin migration, drcsim_gazebo CMakeLists.txt was not including ```test``` subdirectory but it was including some test files into the install command.

This was preventing tests to be properly added via ```add_test```. I've removed references from parent dir and include test directory again.
values.title: Reactivate test generation

summary.raw:
Since catkin migration, drcsim_gazebo CMakeLists.txt was not including ```test``` subdirectory but it was including some test files into the install command.

This was preventing tests to be properly added via ```add_test```. I've removed references from parent dir and include test directory again.
summary.html:
Since catkin migration, drcsim_gazebo CMakeLists.txt was not including test subdirectory but it was including some test files into the install command.

This was preventing tests to be properly added via add_test. I've removed references from parent dir and include test directory again.

values.description:
Fix some hangs and other errors that can happen on shutdown.

The repeated change was to make the `PubMultiQueue` a pointer so that it can be explicilty deleted at the right time during shutdown, thereby avoiding a post-ROS-shutdown call to publish a queued message.
values.title: Clean up shutdown

summary.raw:
Fix some hangs and other errors that can happen on shutdown.

The repeated change was to make the `PubMultiQueue` a pointer so that it can be explicilty deleted at the right time during shutdown, thereby avoiding a post-ROS-shutdown call to publish a queued message.
summary.html:
Fix some hangs and other errors that can happen on shutdown.

The repeated change was to make the PubMultiQueue a pointer so that it can be explicilty deleted at the right time during shutdown, thereby avoiding a post-ROS-shutdown call to publish a queued message.

values.title: Remove drcsim standpipe model to avoid conflict with gazebo_models

values.description:
It depends on the [Polaris XP900 pull request on gazebo_models repo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-request/61/added-polaris-ranger-xp900)



* *drc_vehicle*  loads the Polaris EV. I've created a new *drc_vehicle_xp900* with the Polaris XP900.

* I've updated all *drc_practice_xx* worlds, and the *atlas_drc_vehicle_fire_hose.world* to use the XP900 model.

* The PID gains of the vehicle plugin are now loaded from the SDF. That allows to share the same plugin between different vehicles.

* Note that the topics for controlling the vehicle does not change but the model name does.

Turning the Polaris EV wheels:

```
#!c++

rostopic pub --once  /drc_vehicle/hand_wheel/cmd std_msgs/Float64 '{ data : -3.14 }'
```
Turning the Polaris XP900 wheels:

```
#!c++

rostopic pub --once  /drc_vehicle_xp900/hand_wheel/cmd std_msgs/Float64 '{ data : -3.14 }'

```
values.title: Suppport for the Polaris XP900 vehicle

  • drc_vehicle loads the Polaris EV. I've created a new drc_vehicle_xp900 with the Polaris XP900.

  • I've updated all drc_practice_xx worlds, and the atlas_drc_vehicle_fire_hose.world to use the XP900 model.

  • The PID gains of the vehicle plugin are now loaded from the SDF. That allows to share the same plugin between different vehicles.

  • Note that the topics for controlling the vehicle does not change but the model name does.

Turning the Polaris EV wheels:

rostopic pub --once  /drc_vehicle/hand_wheel/cmd std_msgs/Float64 '{ data : -3.14 }'

Turning the Polaris XP900 wheels:

values.description:
This pull request adds fake implementations of the BDI behavior library functions.  This is done, in the VRCPlugin, by subscribing to `atlas/fake/atlas_sim_interface_command` and publishing to `atlas/fake/atlas_sim_interface_state`.  STAND and MANIPULATE are mapped to pinning the robot, while WALK and STEP are mapped to teleporting the robot with a `cmd_vel`-style planar velocity.

The idea is that if you want to use the fake implementation, you should remap `atlas/atlas_sim_interface_command` and `atlas/atlas_sim_interface_state` to the `/fake/` topics.

This functionality is enabled only if [VRC_CHEATS_ENABLED is 1](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/DRC/UserGuide#Environment_variables).

E.g., to test this functionality with the [keyboard walking tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/drcsim/2.7/keyboard_teleop), you just need to remap the command/state topics for the `actionlib_server`:

~~~
# In one shell
VRC_CHEATS_ENABLED=1 roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas_v3.launch
~~~

~~~
# In another shell
rosrun drcsim_gazebo_ros_plugins actionlib_server /atlas/atlas_sim_interface_command:=/atlas/fake/atlas_sim_interface_command /atlas/atlas_sim_interface_state:=/atlas/fake/atlas_sim_interface_state
~~~

~~~
# In another shell
rosrun drcsim_gazebo keyboard_teleop.py
~~~

In that last shell, give keyboard teleop commands as usual.  Those commands are turned into WALK commands, sent to the the VRCPlugin, then turned into a planar `cmd_vel` and used to teleport the robot.

To switch to user-control mode ([1 is the USER behavior](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/1ccfde1621e7e9555b1dc2d35877db60dcd39b81/atlas_msgs/msg/AtlasSimInterfaceCommand.msg?at=default))

~~~
rostopic pub --once /atlas/fake/atlas_sim_interface_command atlas_msgs/AtlasSimInterfaceCommand '{ behavior: 1 }'
~~~

Very likely the previous command will cause the robot to fall over.
values.title: Add fake behavior support (#385)

summary.raw:
This pull request adds fake implementations of the BDI behavior library functions.  This is done, in the VRCPlugin, by subscribing to `atlas/fake/atlas_sim_interface_command` and publishing to `atlas/fake/atlas_sim_interface_state`.  STAND and MANIPULATE are mapped to pinning the robot, while WALK and STEP are mapped to teleporting the robot with a `cmd_vel`-style planar velocity.

The idea is that if you want to use the fake implementation, you should remap `atlas/atlas_sim_interface_command` and `atlas/atlas_sim_interface_state` to the `/fake/` topics.

This functionality is enabled only if [VRC_CHEATS_ENABLED is 1](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/DRC/UserGuide#Environment_variables).

E.g., to test this functionality with the [keyboard walking tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/drcsim/2.7/keyboard_teleop), you just need to remap the command/state topics for the `actionlib_server`:

~~~
# In one shell
VRC_CHEATS_ENABLED=1 roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas_v3.launch
~~~

~~~
# In another shell
rosrun drcsim_gazebo_ros_plugins actionlib_server /atlas/atlas_sim_interface_command:=/atlas/fake/atlas_sim_interface_command /atlas/atlas_sim_interface_state:=/atlas/fake/atlas_sim_interface_state
~~~

~~~
# In another shell
rosrun drcsim_gazebo keyboard_teleop.py
~~~

In that last shell, give keyboard teleop commands as usual.  Those commands are turned into WALK commands, sent to the the VRCPlugin, then turned into a planar `cmd_vel` and used to teleport the robot.

To switch to user-control mode ([1 is the USER behavior](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/1ccfde1621e7e9555b1dc2d35877db60dcd39b81/atlas_msgs/msg/AtlasSimInterfaceCommand.msg?at=default))

~~~
rostopic pub --once /atlas/fake/atlas_sim_interface_command atlas_msgs/AtlasSimInterfaceCommand '{ behavior: 1 }'
~~~

Very likely the previous command will cause the robot to fall over.
summary.html:
This pull request adds fake implementations of the BDI behavior library functions. This is done, in the VRCPlugin, by subscribing to atlas/fake/atlas_sim_interface_command and publishing to atlas/fake/atlas_sim_interface_state. STAND and MANIPULATE are mapped to pinning the robot, while WALK and STEP are mapped to teleporting the robot with a cmd_vel-style planar velocity.

The idea is that if you want to use the fake implementation, you should remap atlas/atlas_sim_interface_command and atlas/atlas_sim_interface_state to the /fake/ topics.

This functionality is enabled only if VRC_CHEATS_ENABLED is 1.

E.g., to test this functionality with the keyboard walking tutorial, you just need to remap the command/state topics for the actionlib_server:

# In one shell
VRC_CHEATS_ENABLED=1 roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas_v3.launch

# In another shell
rosrun drcsim_gazebo_ros_plugins actionlib_server /atlas/atlas_sim_interface_command:=/atlas/fake/atlas_sim_interface_command /atlas/atlas_sim_interface_state:=/atlas/fake/atlas_sim_interface_state

# In another shell
rosrun drcsim_gazebo keyboard_teleop.py

In that last shell, give keyboard teleop commands as usual. Those commands are turned into WALK commands, sent to the the VRCPlugin, then turned into a planar cmd_vel and used to teleport the robot.

To switch to user-control mode (1 is the USER behavior)

rostopic pub --once /atlas/fake/atlas_sim_interface_command atlas_msgs/AtlasSimInterfaceCommand '{ behavior: 1 }'

Very likely the previous command will cause the robot to fall over.

values.title: Merge drcsim_3.1 to default

values.description:
During startup sequence, enable STAND behavior earlier, before the robot hits the ground, to address issue #376.

Previously, the robot, in STAND_PREP, was dropped at t=9.7s.  Then, at t=10s, STAND was engaged.  It looks to me like this is too late to engage STAND, at least when using the v3_with_v1_inertia model (I don't know why the same thing doesn't happen with the v1 model itself).

This pull request engages STAND at t=9.8s, in an attempt to ensure that the robot is already standing when it hits the ground.  I don't know whether t=9.8s is the best value, but in my testing it results in a standing robot with v1, v3, and v3_with_v1_inertia models.
values.title: Stand earlier (#376)

summary.raw:
During startup sequence, enable STAND behavior earlier, before the robot hits the ground, to address issue #376.

Previously, the robot, in STAND_PREP, was dropped at t=9.7s.  Then, at t=10s, STAND was engaged.  It looks to me like this is too late to engage STAND, at least when using the v3_with_v1_inertia model (I don't know why the same thing doesn't happen with the v1 model itself).

This pull request engages STAND at t=9.8s, in an attempt to ensure that the robot is already standing when it hits the ground.  I don't know whether t=9.8s is the best value, but in my testing it results in a standing robot with v1, v3, and v3_with_v1_inertia models.
summary.html:
During startup sequence, enable STAND behavior earlier, before the robot hits the ground, to address issue #376.

Previously, the robot, in STAND_PREP, was dropped at t=9.7s. Then, at t=10s, STAND was engaged. It looks to me like this is too late to engage STAND, at least when using the v3_with_v1_inertia model (I don't know why the same thing doesn't happen with the v1 model itself).

This pull request engages STAND at t=9.8s, in an attempt to ensure that the robot is already standing when it hits the ground. I don't know whether t=9.8s is the best value, but in my testing it results in a standing robot with v1, v3, and v3_with_v1_inertia models.

values.description:
Change constants in AtlasSimInterfaceCommand message to match the enums in BDI's AtlasRobotInterface/AtlasInterfaceTypes.h, for issue #350.  

This change will break any code that assumes knowledge of the integers underlying these constants, rather than referring to them via the constant symbols that are generated from `.msg` file.  Of course, nobody should be doing that; any code that is using the constants by name should be unaffected.

There will also be a new md5sum on the message, preventing an older publisher from connecting to a newer subscriber (which is a good thing).
values.title: Match up behavior enums (#350)

summary.raw:
Change constants in AtlasSimInterfaceCommand message to match the enums in BDI's AtlasRobotInterface/AtlasInterfaceTypes.h, for issue #350.  

This change will break any code that assumes knowledge of the integers underlying these constants, rather than referring to them via the constant symbols that are generated from `.msg` file.  Of course, nobody should be doing that; any code that is using the constants by name should be unaffected.

There will also be a new md5sum on the message, preventing an older publisher from connecting to a newer subscriber (which is a good thing).
summary.html:
Change constants in AtlasSimInterfaceCommand message to match the enums in BDI's AtlasRobotInterface/AtlasInterfaceTypes.h, for issue #350.

This change will break any code that assumes knowledge of the integers underlying these constants, rather than referring to them via the constant symbols that are generated from .msg file. Of course, nobody should be doing that; any code that is using the constants by name should be unaffected.

There will also be a new md5sum on the message, preventing an older publisher from connecting to a newer subscriber (which is a good thing).

values.description: pull request #413 introduces some API changes, and my build was failing when trying to do `catkin_make install` while a drcsim deb was installed. The deb includes were being preferred to the source includes. This changes the include order to fix it.
values.title: Fix build when deb is installed

summary.raw: pull request #413 introduces some API changes, and my build was failing when trying to do `catkin_make install` while a drcsim deb was installed. The deb includes were being preferred to the source includes. This changes the include order to fix it.

values.description:
Catkin workspaces do not use the top CMakeLists.txt so the AtlasSimInterface was not enabled since the binary compatible system code detection was not run. Since we are only using it in ros plugins, I moved it there.

Thanks to @iche033 for the debugging in pull request #417.
values.title: Fix auto enable of AtlasSimInterface blob in catkin ws

summary.raw:
Catkin workspaces do not use the top CMakeLists.txt so the AtlasSimInterface was not enabled since the binary compatible system code detection was not run. Since we are only using it in ros plugins, I moved it there.

Thanks to @iche033 for the debugging in pull request #417.
summary.html:
Catkin workspaces do not use the top CMakeLists.txt so the AtlasSimInterface was not enabled since the binary compatible system code detection was not run. Since we are only using it in ros plugins, I moved it there.

Thanks to @iche033 for the debugging in pull request #417.

values.title: testing cmake path for when using catkin_make

values.description: drc practice task 8 fire hose dynamic connection offset is fixed, so when firehose is positioned near the standpipe with correct alignment, a screw joint constraint is dynamically created.  Without this patch, screw constraint will not be created for this world.
values.title: fix drc practice task 8 fire hose connection

summary.raw: drc practice task 8 fire hose dynamic connection offset is fixed, so when firehose is positioned near the standpipe with correct alignment, a screw joint constraint is dynamically created.  Without this patch, screw constraint will not be created for this world.
summary.html: drc practice task 8 fire hose dynamic connection offset is fixed, so when firehose is positioned near the standpipe with correct alignment, a screw joint constraint is dynamically created. Without this patch, screw constraint will not be created for this world.

values.title: fix drift by updating activeGoal in actionlib_server

values.description:
1. Reverted inertia tweaks.
 1. Added simbody physics params for atlas and atlas_sandia_hands worlds.
 1. Need [this patch in gazebo to work](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/866/patches-to-get-drcsim-working-with-simbody/diff) (already merged).

To test,

~~~
roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas.launch extra_gazebo_args:="-e simbody"
~~~
values.title: patches for getting atlas to walk in simbody

summary.raw:
1. Reverted inertia tweaks.
 1. Added simbody physics params for atlas and atlas_sandia_hands worlds.
 1. Need [this patch in gazebo to work](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/866/patches-to-get-drcsim-working-with-simbody/diff) (already merged).

To test,

~~~
roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas.launch extra_gazebo_args:="-e simbody"
~~~
summary.html:
1. Reverted inertia tweaks.
  2. Added simbody physics params for atlas and atlas_sandia_hands worlds.
  3. Need this patch in gazebo to work (already merged).

To test,

roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas.launch extra_gazebo_args:="-e simbody"

values.description:
Minor changes to cleanup atlas version 3:

- Fixed inconsistencies in .dae and .stl link files in atlas_description/meshes_v3.  Some files were misnamed to joint names.  Made everything smallcase like in meshes.
- Minor enhancement to bdi_parser to allow for specification of multiple visuals or collisions.
- Added helper text files in atlas_description/raw for differences between the official 'atlas_v3.urdf' and the output 'atlas.urdf' from bdi_parser that were created by hand and I did not deem worth automating.
- Created a new atlas_description/raw/drc_skeleton_v3_201401.cfg based on drc_skeleton_v3_20130823, but with formatting fixed to work with bdi_parser and multiple collision/visuals added.
- New atlas_v3.urdf which includes a head link.
values.title: Update to atlas_v3

summary.raw:
Minor changes to cleanup atlas version 3:

- Fixed inconsistencies in .dae and .stl link files in atlas_description/meshes_v3.  Some files were misnamed to joint names.  Made everything smallcase like in meshes.
- Minor enhancement to bdi_parser to allow for specification of multiple visuals or collisions.
- Added helper text files in atlas_description/raw for differences between the official 'atlas_v3.urdf' and the output 'atlas.urdf' from bdi_parser that were created by hand and I did not deem worth automating.
- Created a new atlas_description/raw/drc_skeleton_v3_201401.cfg based on drc_skeleton_v3_20130823, but with formatting fixed to work with bdi_parser and multiple collision/visuals added.
- New atlas_v3.urdf which includes a head link.
summary.html:
Minor changes to cleanup atlas version 3:

  • Fixed inconsistencies in .dae and .stl link files in atlas_description/meshes_v3. Some files were misnamed to joint names. Made everything smallcase like in meshes.
  • Minor enhancement to bdi_parser to allow for specification of multiple visuals or collisions.
  • Added helper text files in atlas_description/raw for differences between the official 'atlas_v3.urdf' and the output 'atlas.urdf' from bdi_parser that were created by hand and I did not deem worth automating.
  • Created a new atlas_description/raw/drc_skeleton_v3_201401.cfg based on drc_skeleton_v3_20130823, but with formatting fixed to work with bdi_parser and multiple collision/visuals added.
  • New atlas_v3.urdf which includes a head link.

values.description:
We lost the definition of ```ROS_PACKAGE_NAME``` in the transition to catkin. I've implemented it in the two packages using it.

I also removed the check_test_ran.py since we are using the one supplied by ROS anyway, so it is less confusing when searching for the code really in use.
values.title: Fixes to check tests in test suite

summary.raw:
We lost the definition of ```ROS_PACKAGE_NAME``` in the transition to catkin. I've implemented it in the two packages using it.

I also removed the check_test_ran.py since we are using the one supplied by ROS anyway, so it is less confusing when searching for the code really in use.
summary.html:
We lost the definition of ROS_PACKAGE_NAME in the transition to catkin. I've implemented it in the two packages using it.

I also removed the check_test_ran.py since we are using the one supplied by ROS anyway, so it is less confusing when searching for the code really in use.

values.description: This fixes some build errors with boost 1.53, now default on saucy. Note that this same bug was fixed in [gazebo #581](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issue/581/boost-shared_-_cast-are-deprecated-removed), and a cppcheck rule was added to prevent future regressions. There's also another boost 1.53 issue to be resolved for drcsim (#419).
values.title: Fix some compatibility issues with boost 1.53

summary.raw: This fixes some build errors with boost 1.53, now default on saucy. Note that this same bug was fixed in [gazebo #581](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issue/581/boost-shared_-_cast-are-deprecated-removed), and a cppcheck rule was added to prevent future regressions. There's also another boost 1.53 issue to be resolved for drcsim (#419).
summary.html: This fixes some build errors with boost 1.53, now default on saucy. Note that this same bug was fixed in gazebo #581, and a cppcheck rule was added to prevent future regressions. There's also another boost 1.53 issue to be resolved for drcsim (#419).

values.description: The build is currently broken with boost 1.53 (default on saucy). I know saucy isn't a supported platform, but this just provides a workaround so it will at least build. Workaround for #419.
values.title: Workaround for boost 1.53 incompatibility (#419)
